snippet: Players testing positive for marijuana in the Southeastern Conference do not face the one-year suspension that comes with being punished by the N.C.A.A.
abstract: Players testing positive for marijuana in the Southeastern Conference do not face the one-year suspension that comes with being punished by the NCAA; players routinely get third, fourth and even fifth chances before they are suspended.
lead_paragraph: Players testing positive for marijuana in the Southeastern Conference do not face the one-year suspension that comes with being punished by the N.C.A.A.
